title: How to reduce my body heat - Quora

response.answer_text: “Reduce inner body heat”??!! Assuming your “inner body heat” as the Core temperature, Why would somebody do that? The slightest fluctuation in the core body temperature can result in severe medical emergencies often followed by *DEATH* Hot 44 °C (111.2 °F) or more – Almost certainly death will occur; however, people have been known to survive up to 46.5 °C (115.7 °F).43 °C (109.4 °F) – Normally death, or there may be serious brain damage, continuous convulsions and shock. Cardio-respiratory collapse will likely occur.42 °C (107.6 °F) – Subject may turn pale or remain flushed and red. They may become comatose, be in severe delirium, vomiting, and convulsions can occur. Blood pressure may be high or low and heart rate will be very fast.41 °C (105.8 °F) – ( Medical emergency) – Fainting, vomiting, severe headache, dizziness, confusion, hallucinations, delirium and drowsiness can occur. There may also be palpitations and breathlessness.40 °C (104.0 °F) – Fainting, dehydration, weakness, vomiting, headache, breathlessness and dizziness may occur as well as profuse sweating. Starts to be life-threatening.39 °C (102.2 °F) – Severe sweating, flushed and red. Fast heart rate and breathlessness. There may be exhaustion accompanying this. Children and people with epilepsy may be very likely to get convulsions at this point.38 °C (100.4 °F) – (Classed as HYPERTHERMIA if not caused by a fever ) – Feeling hot, sweating, feeling thirsty, feeling very uncomfortable, slightly hungry. If this is caused by fever , there may also be chills.Normal 36.5–37.5 °C (97.7–99.5 °F) is a typically reported range for normal body temperatureCold 36 °C (97 °F) – Feeling cold, mild to moderate shivering (body temperature may drop this low during sleep). May be a normal body temperature.35 °C (95 °F) – ( HYPOTHERMIA is less than 35 °C (95 °F)) – Intense shivering, numbness and bluish/grayness of the skin. There is the possibility of heart irritability.34 °C (93 °F) – Severe shivering, loss of movement of fingers, blueness and confusion. Some behavioural changes may take place.33 °C (91 °F) – Moderate to severe confusion, sleepiness, depressed reflexes, progressive loss of shivering, slow heart beat, shallow breathing. Shivering may stop. Subject may be unresponsive to certain stimuli.32 °C (90 °F) – ( Medical emergency) – Hallucinations, delirium, complete confusion, extreme sleepiness that is progressively becoming comatose. Shivering is absent (subject may even think they are hot). Reflex may be absent or very slight.31 °C (88 °F) – Comatose, very rarely conscious. No or slight reflexes. Very shallow breathing and slow heart rate. Possibility of serious heart rhythm problems.28 °C (82 °F) – Severe heart rhythm disturbances are likely and breathing may stop at any time. Patient may appear to be dead.24–26 °C (75–79 °F) or less – Death usually occurs due to irregular heart beat or respiratory arrest; however, some patients have been known to survive with body temperatures as low as 14.2 °C (57.6 °F)You wanna reduce your core body temperature? Good luck with that. That'll be called “Attempted suicide” At a core body temperature between 85 and 71 degrees F, an inability to move and a low blood pressure lead to coma. Below 71 degrees, muscles grow rigid, and the heart and breathing rate continue to decrease until the person reaches death.

I have a little raised body Temperature than the normal people do. Sometimes my husband complains that i radiate heatwaves during the nights.  Usually when the temperature hits below 27 i feel cold. Really cold. But at times, if I skip to bath or delay it, I cold feel my breathe getting hotter and II start to switch on the a/c again.  Actually on self analysis I found everything that cools you off immediately are harmful to u.  Drink a glass of cold water-- clogs food particles and makes me tired Sleeping under a/c -- absorbs all the water from ur body and leaves u dry. All these are gonna make your body burn more fat and calories to  produce heat. Here 'heat' means the little raised temperature i possess now. What do I do: Every morning I drink water mixed with half lemon juice and a quarter spoon of sweet basil seeds. We call as sabja seeds in India.limit my intake of spicy foodsSwitch to groundnut oil. Coconut oil serves the best but I don't like it's flavour. Prefer room Temperature. Mostly a fan. No a/c.Oil pulling. Once in a week.prefer juice without ice. And bathe in normal room temp water.                                                             So now I don't radiate heat so much. Also I don't drink much water. I drink when I feel thristy and mostly try to find an alternative for water. I always go for flavoured water or juice. But have the habit of eating lots of fruits and vegetables raw. I would also suggest u to use castor or coconut oil on ur scalp and massage it , once in a week.Don't try to bring down ur Tempe immediately.                                                            I have short breathness and asthma. You need to check if you have any respiratory issues and also for thyroid. The final point is... There is nothing wrong with your body. It's just a little special. Treat it that way

Firstly you prevent the source of heat. By staying indoors in a properly ventilated space. Taking bath regularly. Running water from over the head cools down not only the heat from the torso but also the head. Drinking plenty of water and fluids at least 8- 12 glasses a day. Boil 4-5 litres of water with a 2-3 tsps of Dhaniya seeds (Coriander seeds). And drink it daily. Or put a handful of washed Usheer / Khus / Vala roots (Vetiver roots) in the boiled water. Doesn't indicate fluids cold in temperature but those cold in potency. Eg. Teas infused with Chamomile or Rusmari (Rosemarius officinalis). Avoid coffee and hard drinks. Avoid spicy, pungent food. Aroma therapy- Using natural pleasant and cooling aromas at home. Eg. Chandan (Santalum album) fragrance. Tender coconut water, coriander leaves juice ( extract), pomogrenate juice in the morning empty stomach. Using curtains made of Usheer/Vetivera. Sprinkle it with water. Cool wind will flow through it continuously releasing a pleasant aroma. Ayurvedic Medicine- (Following drugs should be taken under the supervision of ayurvedic practitioner only) Sheetasudha by Dhootapapeshwar ltd. Is a very good body coolant. 2 tsp in 1 glass of water. It contains Usheera ( Vetiveria ziznoides).Sootashekhar vati.Kamdudha vati.Pravalpanchamruta vati.Gulkhand (made of rose petals).Shatavari kalpa.Amalaki rasayana.Dr. Sneha

Here Are 5 Effective Foods To Reduce Body Heat Radish  Radish, a water rich vegetable (95% water), is well known for its ability to reduce body heat. This vegetable is also an excellent source of vitamin C. Studies have indicated that consuming foods rich in vitamin C, a powerful antioxidant, can help to reduce body heat. Cucumber  Cucumber contains more water (96 percent water) per serving as compared to other vegetables. Eating cucumber will hydrate the body cells. This in turn will reduce body heat. Cucumber also removes harmful toxins from the body. A build up of toxic matter in the body can be an important causative factor behind consistent rise in body temperature. Pomegranate  Drinking a glass of pomegranate juice first thing in the morning on an empty stomach can drastically reduce body heat. Pomegranates are an excellent source of vitamin C. Vitamin C helps to regulate body temperature by reducing body heat. Coconut Water  The best way to beat rising body temperature is to drink plenty of cooling coconut water. This magical drink is loaded with vital nutrients which help to reduce body heat. Coconut water also replenishes lost bodily fluids due to sudden rise in body temperature. Watermelon  Watermelon which has 95 percent water content, keeps the body cool and well hydrated. A vitamin C rich fruit, watermelon, helps to reduce body heat. A potent detoxifier, watermelon removes harmful toxins from he body – which can cause a sudden rise in body temperature. Have gOOd HealTh…!!!

The human body is one of the most efficient engineering marvels mankind has ever seen. There are Heat Exchangers present in our body to control our body temperature. Our ears helps to cool blood. You must have noticed that when you’re in an embarrassing situation, your ears turn red. This is because in such kind of a situation blood heats up and hence a considerable amount passes through the ear. Since ear has a high surface area, hence the blood can be cooled quickly. The bottom line is, to reduce body heat, apply cold water to your ears and neck, your hands and feet. In a few minutes the body heat should come down.

Summer is here once again and with the season comes a number of diseases. The scorching heat, uncomfortable and sticky weather, excessive water loss from the body in the form of sweat makes us dehydrated and we crave for food which makes us cooler from inside. Juices, cold beverages, juicy fruits, shakes made with fruits, milk, curd, etc seem refreshing and quench our thirst. Here are some foods to reduce body heat and help you stay cool.  We generally like to stay away from oily, spicy and junk food during summer and shift towards light and a natural meal like a fruit or vegetable salad, a bowl of curd or soups for lunch. Checkout the list of heat buster foods described along with the reason as to why we should take them during summer.

Reduces Body Heat Sabja seeds (basil) one of the best source of to reduce body heat. In some Asian countries like Thailand, sabja seeds are used to make a drink along with water, sugar, honey and sometimes coconut milk. It is a great drink to sip on to beat the scorching summer heat. They are one of the best body coolants. They are known to lower your body heat, which is why people often add them to refreshing drinks like nimbu paani, sherbets or milkshakes.

During summer, the temperature of body changes at a rate which is proportional to the difference in temperature, causing burning sensation in eyes, hands and palms of the feet resulting in dehydration. Dawakhana Hakim Ajmal Khan has formulated a drink, Sharbat-e-Sandal (sandal ka sharbat), a well-known healthy and refreshing treat in the scorching summer heat. Additionally, add it in milkshake to augment the taste and flavours or use Sharbat Sandal as a topping on your ice-cream and deserts.

Sit in an A.C. room for five hours. When you come out of the room you wont realize it but when somebody else touch your hand they will feel it colder than usual. We are warm-blooded people, which means we can adjust our body temperature in accordance with the environment so you can't technically change your body temperature.

Stand on a tub filled with water for 10 minutes. It lose all your excessive body heat immediately. The heat flows from your head to your feet, followed by feet to water. You will feel fresh and cool after this activity. Your body won’t heat up up-to 5–6 hours.
